title: Recovery teams continue search in Mexico City after quake
description:
(26 Sep 2017) Recovery teams in Mexico City continued their search operations on Tuesday, a week after a powerful earthquake caused widespread damaged in the capital.
Mexican officials are tallying up the economic losses of the magnitude 7.1 earthquake which struck on 19 September. 
The death toll in the quake has risen to 331, with 192 of those deaths in Mexico City. 
Authorities pledged a return to normality, but many streets in the capital were still blocked by construction equipment and recovery teams looking to extract the last remaining bodies from the rubble.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/9060363195beaf7a7b6c6dbe5b1604f3 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork
